meanings.sent1: She colourises her drawings with bright markers.
meanings.sent2: The artist colourises the black and white photo to make it more vibrant.
meanings.sent3: The little girl colourises her coloring book with crayons.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling colourises the mundane events of everyday life.
meanings.sent5: The sunset colourises the sky with shades of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: To change or enhance the color of something.
meanings.sent1: The decorator colourises the room with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: The digital editing software can colourises old photographs beautifully.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand colourises the dull landscape into a magical world.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter colourises the room with joy and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The rainbow colourises the sky after the rain, bringing hope and beauty.
